snippet: Recent tremors may have quadrupled the odds of more big jolts soon in Southern California, creating nearly a 50-50 chance of a major earthquake within five years, according to report issued Monday.   Richard Andrews, director of the state Office o...
lead_paragraph: Recent tremors may have quadrupled the odds of more big jolts soon in Southern California, creating nearly a 50-50 chance of a major earthquake within five years, according to report issued Monday. Richard Andrews, director of the state Office of Emergency Services, said the risk of another quake measuring 7 or more on the Richter scale "has been increased significantly" as a result of the 7.5 Landers and 6.6 Big Bear earthquakes on June 28.

headline.main: U.S. Offers Updated Odds on Major Quakes
